title: Fixed bottom shared Products & Services description section with click-to-scroll updates

requirements.summary: Add one shared description section near the bottom of the one-page layout (immediately before the existing Footer) whose internal content updates based on the selected Products & Services item.
acceptanceCriteria: A single new section exists near the bottom of the one-page layout and is placed immediately before the existing Footer in frontend/src/App.tsx.
The section is always the bottom-most content area of the page (excluding the existing Footer and the existing mobile sticky action bar).
No additional pages, popups, cards, or accordions are introduced for this feature.
No existing global layout, fonts, colors, or styling are changed outside what is required to insert and support this section.

file_operations.description: Insert a new shared bottom description <section> as the last content section immediately before the existing <footer>. Add local state for the currently-selected service (defaulting to one of the existing 5 titles) and render only the section’s internal heading/description from that state; do not introduce new pages/popups/cards/accordions. Keep styling changes minimal and localized to this new section only.

requirements.summary: Make each existing Products & Services item clickable to smoothly scroll to the shared bottom section and update that section’s heading/description to match the clicked item.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking each of the 5 existing service items triggers a smooth scroll to the bottom shared description section.
After the scroll, the bottom section content reflects the clicked item (correct heading and description).
Only the bottom section content changes; the Products & Services grid continues to render as image + title only.
No new animations are added beyond the required smooth scroll behavior.

file_operations.description: Update the existing services grid so each of the 5 Cards is interactive (e.g., onClick + keyboard activation) without changing the card’s content (still image + title only). On activation, set the selected service state and trigger smooth scrolling to the shared bottom description section via a ref/id (no additional animations beyond smooth scroll).

requirements.summary: Implement the exact provided English heading/description mapping for the 5 services and render it in the shared bottom section.
acceptanceCriteria: For each of the 5 service titles, the bottom section renders the exact corresponding heading and description text as provided by the user (no paraphrasing).
The correct content is shown consistently after repeated clicks across different items.

file_operations.description: Add a constant mapping keyed by the 5 existing service titles and render the exact user-provided heading/description strings in the bottom section based on selected state. Ensure repeated clicks across items consistently show the correct corresponding text (no paraphrasing, no extra punctuation/wording).

requirements.summary: Add Call and WhatsApp actions below the bottom-section description using the existing phone number and existing WhatsApp click-to-chat behavior via WhatsAppQuickMessages, with no backend/data-capture logic.
acceptanceCriteria: The bottom section displays a Call button that opens the dialer using tel:+919840077591.
The bottom section displays a WhatsApp action that uses click-to-chat only (wa.me) with the existing WhatsApp number 919840077591.
No backend changes are introduced for this feature.

file_operations.description: In the new bottom description section, add a Call button that links to tel:+919840077591 using the existing shadcn-ui Button component (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing). Add a WhatsApp action using the existing WhatsAppQuickMessages component wired to the existing whatsappNumber so it remains wa.me click-to-chat only (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing). Do not add any data capture, reminders, automation, or backend logic.

requirements.summary: Ensure click-to-scroll keeps the one-page structure intact and that the bottom section remains readable on mobile without being obscured by the existing mobile sticky bottom action bar.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, after clicking a Products & Services item and scrolling to the bottom section, the section’s heading and description are visible and not hidden behind the existing sticky bottom action bar.
The existing sticky bottom action bar (Call | WhatsApp | Map) remains present and unchanged in structure and behavior.

file_operations.description: Adjust the smooth-scroll implementation to account for the existing mobile sticky bottom action bar so the bottom section’s heading/description are not obscured after scrolling (e.g., scroll with a computed offset or align-to-top behavior). Keep the existing mobile-only sticky bottom action bar unchanged in structure/behavior, and avoid global styling changes outside what is strictly required.
